line up.translation[0].definitions[0].de: if people line up, or if you line them up, they stand in a row or line, or you make them do this
line up.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: He lined us all up in the corridor.
line up.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to arrange things in a row
line up.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: I lined the bottles up on the sideboard.
line up.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to move one thing so that it is in the correct position in relation to something else
line up.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: The windows should be lined up with the door frame.
line up.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to arrange for something to happen or for someone to be available for an event
line up.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: We’ve lined up some excellent speakers for tonight.
He’s already got a new job lined up.
line up.translation[1].definitions[0].de: the players in a sports team who play in a particular game
line up.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: This was his first match in the starting line-up  (=the players who begin the game).
line up.translation[1].definitions[1].de: a group of people, especially performers, who have agreed to be involved in an event
line up.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: The line-up included top bands Prodigy and Radiohead.
line up.translation[1].definitions[2].de: a number of events or programmes arranged to follow each other
line up.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: a wonderful line-up of programmes for Christmas and the New Year
line up.translation[1].definitions[3].de: a row of people who stand in front of a witness to a crime, who is then asked if he or she recognizes any of them as the criminal
